concepts.name: Product Vision Over Features
concepts.quote: The more specific the vision, the better decisions you make

concepts.name: LNO Framework (Leverage, Neutral, Overhead)
concepts.quote: LNO helps you see which work creates leverage vs just keeps the lights on

concepts.name: Pre-mortem Technique
concepts.quote: Ask: 'It's 6 months from now, this failed. What happened?'

concepts.name: Product-Led Growth (PLG)
concepts.quote: PLG is about making your product the main vehicle for acquisition, activation, and retention

concepts.name: Positioning Canvas
concepts.quote: Positioning is the act of deliberately defining how you are the best at something

concepts.name: Jobs to Be Done (JTBD)
concepts.quote: People don't buy products, they hire them to make progress in their lives

concepts.name: Forces of Progress
concepts.quote: Push of the situation, pull of new solution, anxiety of new, habit of present

concepts.name: Network Effects
concepts.quote: Network effects make your product more valuable as more people use it

concepts.name: Cold Start Problem
concepts.quote: You need an atomic network: the smallest network that can stand on its own

concepts.name: Marketplace Liquidity
concepts.quote: Track time to fill: how long until supply meets demand in your marketplace

concepts.name: Retention Curves
concepts.quote: Retention curves that flatten are the signal you've found PMF

concepts.name: Empowered Teams vs Feature Teams
concepts.quote: Give teams problems to solve, not features to build

concepts.name: Product Discovery
concepts.quote: Discovery is about rapidly testing ideas with customers, not building

concepts.name: Four Key Product Risks
concepts.quote: Every product must be valuable, usable, feasible, and viable

concepts.name: Outcome Over Output
concepts.quote: Product teams are about outcomes, not output. Solve the problem.

concepts.name: Three Pillars of Product Ops
concepts.quote: Business data, customer insights, and process governance

concepts.name: Product Ops as PM Enablement
concepts.quote: Product ops frees PMs from busy work to focus on strategic decisions

concepts.name: Escaping the Build Trap
concepts.quote: Focus on outcomes and value, not just shipping features

concepts.name: Continuous Discovery Habits
concepts.quote: Weekly touchpoints with customers to inform product decisions

concepts.name: Speed as a Competitive Advantage
concepts.quote: Speed is the most underrated product advantage. Ship fast, learn faster.

concepts.name: Product Manager as CEO of Product
concepts.quote: PMs own the 'what' and 'why', engineers own the 'how'

concepts.name: DHM Model (Delight, Hard to Copy, Margin)
concepts.quote: Great products delight customers, are hard to copy, and have business margin

concepts.name: Product Strategy Means Saying No
concepts.quote: Strategy is as much about what you choose not to do

concepts.name: North Star Metric Framework
concepts.quote: One metric that captures the core value you deliver to customers

concepts.name: Design Critique Framework
concepts.quote: Great critique focuses on goals, not personal taste

concepts.name: Manager Effectiveness Framework
concepts.quote: Your job as a manager is to get better outcomes from a group of people

concepts.name: Fast Feedback Loops
concepts.quote: The faster you learn, the faster you improve

concepts.name: Product-Market Fit Engine
concepts.quote: Survey users: how disappointed would you be if this product disappeared?

concepts.name: 40% Rule for PMF
concepts.quote: If 40% say very disappointed, you have product-market fit

concepts.name: Speed as a Feature
concepts.quote: Superhuman loads in under 100ms. Speed is the product's foundation.

concepts.name: Product Rituals
concepts.quote: Rituals turn values into daily habits for teams

concepts.name: 11-Star Experience Exercise
concepts.quote: Imagine a 5-star experience. Now imagine 11 stars. What would that be?

concepts.name: Founder Mode
concepts.quote: Stay in the details. The magic is in the craft.

concepts.name: Product and Marketing as One
concepts.quote: The product is the marketing. Make something people want to talk about.

concepts.name: Impact vs Effort Matrix
concepts.quote: Most teams overestimate effort and underestimate impact

concepts.name: Product Work Types Framework
concepts.quote: Core work, enabling work, and everything else. Know the difference.

concepts.name: PM Career Ladders
concepts.quote: Junior PMs execute. Senior PMs think in systems and strategy.

concepts.name: Growth Loops Over Funnels
concepts.quote: Funnels leak. Loops compound. Build self-reinforcing growth.

concepts.name: PLG Customer Segments
concepts.quote: Different users have different activation moments. Map them all.

concepts.name: Net Revenue Retention
concepts.quote: NRR over 100% means existing customers are growing your revenue

concepts.name: Category Creation vs Competition
concepts.quote: If you can't win in an existing category, create a new one

concepts.name: Competitive Alternatives Framework
concepts.quote: Your competition isn't other products. It's how people solve this today.

concepts.name: Value Pillars
concepts.quote: Identify 3-5 things that make you demonstrably better than alternatives

concepts.name: Switching Interview Technique
concepts.quote: Interview people who recently switched to understand their journey

concepts.name: Struggling Moments
concepts.quote: Innovation happens when you find the struggling moment in someone's life

concepts.name: Demand-Side vs Supply-Side
concepts.quote: Most companies are supply-side focused. Winners focus on demand.

concepts.name: Growth Accounting
concepts.quote: Break down growth into new, retained, resurrected, and churned users

concepts.name: Input Metrics vs Output Metrics
concepts.quote: Output metrics show results. Input metrics show what drives results.

concepts.name: Product Culture vs Feature Factory
concepts.quote: In feature factories, PMs write specs. In product companies, they solve problems.

concepts.name: Strategic Context for Teams
concepts.quote: Teams need vision, strategy, and objectives to make good decisions

concepts.name: PM Core Competencies
concepts.quote: Know users, know data, know business, know industry

concepts.name: Coaching Over Process
concepts.quote: Scale with leaders who coach, not with process

concepts.name: Three Sacred PM Access Points
concepts.quote: PMs need direct access to customers, engineers, and stakeholders

concepts.name: Strategy Deployment
concepts.quote: Strategy is worthless if it doesn't translate to daily decisions

concepts.name: SPADE Decision Framework
concepts.quote: Setting, People, Alternatives, Decide, Explain. Structure big decisions.

concepts.name: Disagree and Commit
concepts.quote: After debate, commit fully even if you disagreed

concepts.name: Rapid Experimentation
concepts.quote: Run 100 experiments. 10 will succeed. That's your edge.

concepts.name: Consumer Science Tests
concepts.quote: Test with 50-100 users before building. Saves months of work.

concepts.name: Design Portfolio Review
concepts.quote: Judge designers by their process, not just pixels

concepts.name: Effective 1-on-1s
concepts.quote: 1-on-1s are for them, not you. Ask what they need.

concepts.name: Delegation Framework
concepts.quote: Delegate outcomes, not tasks. Give context, not instructions.

concepts.name: User Segmentation for PMF
concepts.quote: Double down on users who would be very disappointed to lose you

concepts.name: First-Time User Experience
concepts.quote: Your onboarding should get users to their aha moment fast

concepts.name: Founder Storytelling
concepts.quote: The founder's job is to tell a story that inspires people to join

concepts.name: Weekly Design Reviews
concepts.quote: I review every product detail weekly. This is where quality comes from.

concepts.name: Execution Taxonomy
concepts.quote: Strategy, planning, execution, learning. Know which phase you're in.

concepts.name: Tech Debt Framework
concepts.quote: Tech debt is okay if it's strategic. Make it conscious, not accidental.

concepts.name: Activation Moment
concepts.quote: Find the moment users first experience value. Optimize that.

concepts.name: Value-Based Pricing
concepts.quote: Price on value delivered, not cost to build

concepts.name: Sales Positioning Playbook
concepts.quote: Positioning isn't marketing fluff. It's how sales wins deals.

concepts.name: Market Category Selection
concepts.quote: Pick a category where your strengths become the buying criteria

concepts.name: Timeline Interview Technique
concepts.quote: Walk backward from the purchase to understand the decision journey

concepts.name: Causation Over Correlation
concepts.quote: Understanding why causes behavior lets you predict and influence it

concepts.name: Referral Loops
concepts.quote: Best referral programs are built into the product, not bolted on

concepts.name: Marketplace Balance
concepts.quote: Monitor both sides of your marketplace. Imbalance kills growth.

concepts.name: PM Attendance at User Research
concepts.quote: If the PM can't attend user research, cancel it. They must be there.

concepts.name: Solution Discovery vs Problem Discovery
concepts.quote: Most teams spend too much time on the problem. Win on the solution.

concepts.name: Problem-Based Roadmaps
concepts.quote: Roadmaps should list problems to solve, not features to build

concepts.name: Product Owner vs Product Manager
concepts.quote: Product owners coordinate. Product managers make strategic decisions.

concepts.name: Product Ops Team Sizing
concepts.quote: If you're at 1:1 ops to PM ratio, you're doing it wrong

concepts.name: Metrics Tree Framework
concepts.quote: Break your north star into leading indicators you can action

concepts.name: Product Review Cadence
concepts.quote: Weekly product reviews keep quality high and everyone aligned

concepts.name: Culture Deck
concepts.quote: Write down your culture explicitly. Netflix did. You should too.

concepts.name: A/B Testing Discipline
concepts.quote: Test everything. Let data trump opinions.

concepts.name: Feedback Equation
concepts.quote: Observation + Impact + Question. That's the feedback formula.

concepts.name: Raising the Hiring Bar
concepts.quote: Every hire should raise your team's average. No exceptions.

concepts.name: Power User Features
concepts.quote: Keyboard shortcuts make power users feel superhuman

concepts.name: Waitlist as Positioning
concepts.quote: A waitlist builds anticipation and creates exclusivity

concepts.name: Mission-Driven Product
concepts.quote: Our mission 'belong anywhere' guides every product decision

concepts.name: Two-Sided Platform Balance
concepts.quote: In marketplaces, obsess over both sides equally

concepts.name: Three Types of PMs
concepts.quote: Craftsperson, operator, or strategist. Know which you are.

concepts.name: Escalation Framework
concepts.quote: Escalate early when stuck. Waiting wastes everyone's time.

concepts.name: When to Monetize
concepts.quote: Monetize after you've proven value, not before

concepts.name: Viral Coefficient
concepts.quote: K factor above 1 means exponential growth. That's the goal.

concepts.name: Positioning Workshop Format
concepts.quote: Get cross-functional team in a room for 4 hours. Come out aligned.

concepts.name: Active Listening in Interviews
concepts.quote: Listen to what they did, not what they say they'll do

concepts.name: K-Factor Measurement
concepts.quote: Invites sent x conversion rate = viral coefficient

concepts.name: Continuous Deployment
concepts.quote: Ship multiple times per day. Releases should be non-events.

concepts.name: Disease of Process People
concepts.quote: Process kills innovation. Scale with leaders, not process.

concepts.name: Quick Wins for Product Ops
concepts.quote: Start with one pillar. Show value fast. Then expand.

concepts.name: Product Transformation
concepts.quote: Training alone won't transform. You need systems and ops too.

concepts.name: Writing Culture
concepts.quote: Write down decisions. It forces clear thinking.

concepts.name: Reverse Press Release
concepts.quote: Write the launch press release first. Work backward from there.

concepts.name: Developing Product Taste
concepts.quote: Taste comes from seeing thousands of examples and critiquing them

concepts.name: Delight Through Details
concepts.quote: Small details create emotional connection with your product

concepts.name: Zero to One Products
concepts.quote: Do things that don't scale first. Perfect the experience.

concepts.name: The Art of Saying No
concepts.quote: Learn to say no gracefully. Your roadmap depends on it.

concepts.name: Freemium Model Design
concepts.quote: Free tier should create habit. Paid tier unlocks scale.

concepts.name: Messaging Hierarchy
concepts.quote: Lead with differentiation, not features. Why you, not what you do.

concepts.name: Jobs Interview Script
concepts.quote: First thought, when, where, who, what trade-offs. Follow the story.

concepts.name: Growth Team Structure
concepts.quote: Growth teams own metrics. Product teams own features.

concepts.name: Compelling Product Vision
concepts.quote: Vision should be inspiring and 2-5 years out

concepts.name: Product Ops Data Expertise
concepts.quote: First product ops hire often comes from consulting or data analytics

concepts.name: Six-Page Narratives
concepts.quote: Amazon bans PowerPoint. Write narratives. Read silently. Then discuss.

concepts.name: Customer Delight Metric
concepts.quote: Track delight explicitly. It predicts retention better than engagement.

concepts.name: Growth Mindset in Teams
concepts.quote: Hire for learning ability, not just experience

concepts.name: Vertical Focus Strategy
concepts.quote: Win one vertical completely before expanding horizontally

concepts.name: Trust and Safety as Core
concepts.quote: In marketplaces, trust isn't a feature. It's the foundation.

concepts.name: Influence Without Authority
concepts.quote: PMs influence through data, storytelling, and relationships

concepts.name: PLG-Sales Hybrid Model
concepts.quote: Product gets users in. Sales closes the big accounts.

concepts.name: Competitive Feature Matrix
concepts.quote: Don't compete on feature parity. Compete on different dimensions.

concepts.name: Measuring Innovation Progress
concepts.quote: Track struggling moments solved, not features shipped

concepts.name: Geographic Expansion Strategy
concepts.quote: Build density in one city before expanding to the next

concepts.name: Missionaries vs Mercenaries
concepts.quote: Missionaries believe in the mission. Mercenaries just do their job.

concepts.name: Portfolio Roadmap View
concepts.quote: Executives need portfolio view, not Jira tickets

concepts.name: Board Meeting Preparation
concepts.quote: Spend 2 weeks on your board deck. It's that important.

concepts.name: Triple Double Strategy
concepts.quote: Double engagement, double content, double revenue. That's scale.

concepts.name: Design Sprint Method
concepts.quote: 5 days to solve big problems and test new ideas

concepts.name: Word of Mouth Engine
concepts.quote: Build something so good people can't help but tell others

concepts.name: Professional Photography Program
concepts.quote: We sent photographers to hosts' homes. Bookings doubled overnight.

concepts.name: PM Anti-Patterns
concepts.quote: Order taker, feature factory worker, pixel pusher. Avoid these traps.

concepts.name: Cohort Analysis
concepts.quote: Compare user cohorts over time to spot what's working

concepts.name: Pivot Positioning Strategy
concepts.quote: When pivoting, reposition completely. Don't confuse the market.

concepts.name: Hire and Fire Forces
concepts.quote: Understand both why people hire your product and why they fire it

concepts.name: Content Distribution Strategy
concepts.quote: Create content where your users already spend time

concepts.name: Stakeholder Management
concepts.quote: Bring stakeholders prototypes, not requirements. Show don't tell.

concepts.name: OKR Deployment
concepts.quote: OKRs cascade down. Track them in dashboards, not spreadsheets.

concepts.name: Weekly Metrics Review
concepts.quote: Review your key metrics every Monday. No exceptions.

concepts.name: Experimentation Budget
concepts.quote: Allocate 10-20% of eng time to experiments. Protect it.

concepts.name: First 90 Days as PM
concepts.quote: Spend first month learning, second building trust, third executing

concepts.name: Transparent Pricing
concepts.quote: Show pricing publicly. It qualifies leads and builds trust.
